document_data.name: Pen

document_data.mainbody:
The Paper Warrior owned a magical pen that would literally rewrite the perception of reality of his enemies. The effects of the enchanted pen would confuse or even [[charm]] those who were struck.

* A ''[[fire quill]]'' could be summoned by the [[arcane]] spell of the same name. These quill pens could write letters formed of leaping illusory flames. The words written by fire quills could be read by those even several feet away.

Description.Uses:
[[File:QuillPen.png|thumb|273px|A quill pen.]]
Pens were used to transfer ink to [[paper]], usually by scholars to scribe [[book]]s and diplomats to write and sign contracts. Special forgery pens were produced for those who wanted to alter documents with precision. Simple pens were included in [[map-making kit]]s.

Pens were symbols of authority in [[Kara-Tur]] and represented two of the nine [[Gifts of the Faith]]. [[Gold]]en pens represented writing and [[jade]] pens represented history. Pen schools that taught art were even known the exist in the eastern continent, particularly the one founded by [[Shen Shou]].

Quill pens were used as [[material component]]s for several [[spell]]s, both [[divine]] and [[arcane]]. However, if one wanted to scribe a [[magic]]al scroll, special types of pens would be needed, such as quills made from magical beasts.
Description.Types: There were several types of ink pen, from simple [[goose]] feather quills to special metal-nibbed pens. They ranged in price depending on the quality of the pen. Standard ink pens cost just 2 [[cp]] each, but deluxe metal nibs imported from [[Kara-Tur]] sold for 70 [[gp]] a set. More modern pens were designed to hold reservoirs of ink, so that they did not need to be continuously dipped in ink, unlike quills.
Description.Alternatives: Spells could be use to replicate the effect of a pen and ink. The ''[[amanuensis]]'' spell created an animated pen to duplicate magical writing. The magical pen could write just as quick as the caster, and the caster did not even have to be present.

document_data.Powers: [[Magic]]al pens were known to exist throughout the [[multiverse]]. One such item was a quill pen that hovered above paper and wrote by itself. It also had the capabilities of speaking [[Common]].
document_data.History:
In ancient times, the [[overgod]] [[Ao]] created the [[Tablets of Fate]]. Before they assumed the form of tablets, they appeared as a quill pen of misty force (as well as other forms).

{{Quote
|Here the pen truly is mightier than the [[sword]], here the sculptor's [[hammer]] outweighs the [[war hammer]], and spells of creation are valued above those of destruction.
|A description of the values of [[Silverymoon]] under [[Alustriel]]'s command
}}
In [[1357 DR]], the catacombs of [[Waterdeep]] contained a magical pen that could speak and write without a user. 

In the 15{{th}} century [[DR]], the [[beholder]] [[Lorthuun]] guarded a [[Zhentarim]] warehouse in [[Mantol-Derith]]. The warehouse stockpiled several useful items, including several ink pens.
document_data.Symbology:
[[File:Estelmer.jpg|thumb|250px|A quill pen featured on the coat of arms of the Estelmer family.]] {{Quote |He who wields a [[sword]] serves his community with courage.
But he who wields a pen serves with elegance. |An inhabitant of the City of Doors, [[Sigil]] }} Those of the [[Stationers' Guild]] of [[Waterdeep]] wore white [[robe]]s with black quill pens on their breasts. The Waterdhavian [[Estelmer]] family were skilled printers and their [[heraldry|coat of arm]]s featured a turquoise quill pen. [[Jergal]]'s holy symbol was that of a quill pen upon a skull, and [[Deneir]], the Scribe of [[Oghma]] was represented as a scholar holding a quill pen. Pens were often used as the representation of peace and civilization, as opposed to the sword, which represented war and battle.
document_data.Notable Owners:
{{Quote
|When these truths became apparent to me, I decided that it was probably a good time to pick up my pen and tell the world my story.
|[[Athanial]] the Wind
}}
* [[Ito Chomei]], the Paper Warrior. If Chomei's quill pen or paper was moved, the words inked onto the paper would spring to life, summoning the Paper Warrior. The Paper Warrior fought with a magical pen that could confuse his enemies. He also kept a box of pen nibs, though one was actually a [[katana]] charm that fit into a special medallion.

* [[Lhaeo]], the scribe of [[Elminster]], was known to stockpile ink pens, ink, and parchment. He insisted that letters to his master must be written in [[Common]], [[Thorass]], and [[Dwarvish]].

* [[Quillan]] the Sage, a treasurer who calculated the [[Council of Bloodstone]]'s wealth with his quill pen.

The [[adventuress]] [[Zaranda Star]] owned a pen from Kara-Tur made from a spine from a [[sahuagin]] and tipped with a [[steel]] nib.
